78/*
79 * XXXDCL As the API for accessing file statistics undoubtedly gets expanded,
80 * it might be good to provide a mechanism that allows for the results
81 * of a previous stat() to be used again without having to do another stat,
82 * such as perl's mechanism of using "_" in place of a file name to indicate
83 * that the results of the last stat should be used. But then you get into
84 * annoying MP issues. BTW, Win32 has stat().
85 */
86static isc_result_t
87file_stats(const char *file, struct stat *stats) {
88 isc_result_t result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
89
90 REQUIRE(file != NULL);
91 REQUIRE(stats != NULL);
92
93 if (stat(file, stats) != 0)
94 result = isc__errno2result(errno);
95
96 return (result);
97}
98
99static isc_result_t
100fd_stats(int fd, struct stat *stats) {
101 isc_result_t result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
102
103 REQUIRE(stats != NULL);
104
105 if (fstat(fd, stats) != 0)
106 result = isc__errno2result(errno);
107
108 return (result);
109}
110
111isc_result_t
112isc_file_getsizefd(int fd, off_t *size) {
113 isc_result_t result;
114 struct stat stats;
115
116 REQUIRE(size != NULL);
117
118 result = fd_stats(fd, &stats);
119
120 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS)
121 *size = stats.st_size;
122
123 return (result);
124}
125
126isc_result_t
127isc_file_mode(const char *file, mode_t *modep) {
128 isc_result_t result;
129 struct stat stats;
130
131 REQUIRE(modep != NULL);
132
133 result = file_stats(file, &stats);
134 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS)
135 *modep = (stats.st_mode & 07777);
136
137 return (result);
138}
139
140isc_result_t
141isc_file_getmodtime(const char *file, isc_time_t *modtime) {
142 isc_result_t result;
143 struct stat stats;
144
145 REQUIRE(file != NULL);
146 REQUIRE(modtime != NULL);
147
148 result = file_stats(file, &stats);
149
150 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS)
151#if defined(HAVE_STAT_NSEC)
152 isc_time_set(modtime, stats.st_mtime, stats.st_mtim.tv_nsec);
153#else
154 isc_time_set(modtime, stats.st_mtime, 0);
155#endif
156
157 return (result);
158}
159
160isc_result_t
161isc_file_getsize(const char *file, off_t *size) {
162 isc_result_t result;
163 struct stat stats;
164
165 REQUIRE(file != NULL);
166 REQUIRE(size != NULL);
167
168 result = file_stats(file, &stats);
169
170 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS)
171 *size = stats.st_size;
172
173 return (result);
174}
175
176isc_result_t
177isc_file_settime(const char *file, isc_time_t *when) {
178 struct timeval times[2];
179
180 REQUIRE(file != NULL && when != NULL);
181
182 /*
183 * tv_sec is at least a 32 bit quantity on all platforms we're
184 * dealing with, but it is signed on most (all?) of them,
185 * so we need to make sure the high bit isn't set. This unfortunately
186 * loses when either:
187 * * tv_sec becomes a signed 64 bit integer but long is 32 bits
188 * and isc_time_seconds > LONG_MAX, or
189 * * isc_time_seconds is changed to be > 32 bits but long is 32 bits
190 * and isc_time_seconds has at least 33 significant bits.
191 */
192 times[0].tv_sec = times[1].tv_sec = (long)isc_time_seconds(when);
193
194 /*
195 * Here is the real check for the high bit being set.
196 */
197 if ((times[0].tv_sec &
198 (1ULL << (sizeof(times[0].tv_sec) * CHAR_BIT - 1))) != 0)
199 return (ISC_R_RANGE);
200
201 /*
202 * isc_time_nanoseconds guarantees a value that divided by 1000 will
203 * fit into the minimum possible size tv_usec field.
204 */
205 times[0].tv_usec = times[1].tv_usec =
206 (int32_t)(isc_time_nanoseconds(when) / 1000);
207
208 if (utimes(file, times) < 0)
209 return (isc__errno2result(errno));
210
211 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
212}
213
214#undef TEMPLATE
215#define TEMPLATE "tmp-XXXXXXXXXX" /*%< 14 characters. */
216
217isc_result_t
218isc_file_mktemplate(const char *path, char *buf, size_t buflen) {
219 return (isc_file_template(path, TEMPLATE, buf, buflen));
220}
221
222isc_result_t
223isc_file_template(const char *path, const char *templet, char *buf,
224 size_t buflen)
225{
226 const char *s;
227
228 REQUIRE(templet != NULL);
229 REQUIRE(buf != NULL);
230
231 if (path == NULL)
232 path = "";
233
234 s = strrchr(templet, '/');
235 if (s != NULL)
236 templet = s + 1;
237
238 s = strrchr(path, '/');
239
240 if (s != NULL) {
241 size_t prefixlen = s - path + 1;
242 if ((prefixlen + strlen(templet) + 1) > buflen)
243 return (ISC_R_NOSPACE);
244
245 /* Copy 'prefixlen' bytes and NUL terminate. */
246 strlcpy(buf, path, ISC_MIN(prefixlen + 1, buflen));
247 strlcat(buf, templet, buflen);
248 } else {
249 if ((strlen(templet) + 1) > buflen)
250 return (ISC_R_NOSPACE);
251
252 strlcpy(buf, templet, buflen);
253 }
254
255 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
256}
257
258static const char alphnum[] =
259 "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789";
260
261isc_result_t
262isc_file_renameunique(const char *file, char *templet) {
263 char *x;
264 char *cp;
265
266 REQUIRE(file != NULL);
267 REQUIRE(templet != NULL);
268
269 cp = templet;
270 while (*cp != '\0')
271 cp++;
272 if (cp == templet)
273 return (ISC_R_FAILURE);
274
275 x = cp--;
276 while (cp >= templet && *cp == 'X') {
277 *cp = alphnum[isc_random_uniform(sizeof(alphnum) - 1)];
278 x = cp--;
279 }
280 while (link(file, templet) == -1) {
281 if (errno != EEXIST)
282 return (isc__errno2result(errno));
283 for (cp = x;;) {
284 const char *t;
285 if (*cp == '\0')
286 return (ISC_R_FAILURE);
287 t = strchr(alphnum, *cp);
288 if (t == NULL || *++t == '\0')
289 *cp++ = alphnum[0];
290 else {
291 *cp = *t;
292 break;
293 }
294 }
295 }
296 if (unlink(file) < 0)
297 if (errno != ENOENT)
298 return (isc__errno2result(errno));
299 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
300}
301
302isc_result_t
303isc_file_openunique(char *templet, FILE **fp) {
304 int mode = S_IWUSR|S_IRUSR|S_IRGRP|S_IWGRP|S_IROTH|S_IWOTH;
305 return (isc_file_openuniquemode(templet, mode, fp));
306}
307
308isc_result_t
309isc_file_openuniqueprivate(char *templet, FILE **fp) {
310 int mode = S_IWUSR|S_IRUSR;
311 return (isc_file_openuniquemode(templet, mode, fp));
312}
313
314isc_result_t
315isc_file_openuniquemode(char *templet, int mode, FILE **fp) {
316 int fd;
317 FILE *f;
318 isc_result_t result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
319 char *x;
320 char *cp;
321
322 REQUIRE(templet != NULL);
323 REQUIRE(fp != NULL && *fp == NULL);
324
325 cp = templet;
326 while (*cp != '\0')
327 cp++;
328 if (cp == templet)
329 return (ISC_R_FAILURE);
330
331 x = cp--;
332 while (cp >= templet && *cp == 'X') {
333 *cp = alphnum[isc_random_uniform(sizeof(alphnum) - 1)];
334 x = cp--;
335 }
336
337
338 while ((fd = open(templet, O_RDWR|O_CREAT|O_EXCL, mode)) == -1) {
339 if (errno != EEXIST)
340 return (isc__errno2result(errno));
341 for (cp = x;;) {
342 char *t;
343 if (*cp == '\0')
344 return (ISC_R_FAILURE);
345 t = strchr(alphnum, *cp);
346 if (t == NULL || *++t == '\0')
347 *cp++ = alphnum[0];
348 else {
349 *cp = *t;
350 break;
351 }
352 }
353 }
354 f = fdopen(fd, "w+");
355 if (f == NULL) {
356 result = isc__errno2result(errno);
357 if (remove(templet) < 0) {
358 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
359 ISC_LOGMODULE_FILE, ISC_LOG_ERROR,
360 "remove '%s': failed", templet);
361 }
362 (void)close(fd);
363 } else
364 *fp = f;
365
366 return (result);
367}
368
369isc_result_t
370isc_file_bopenunique(char *templet, FILE **fp) {
371 int mode = S_IWUSR|S_IRUSR|S_IRGRP|S_IWGRP|S_IROTH|S_IWOTH;
372 return (isc_file_openuniquemode(templet, mode, fp));
373}
374
375isc_result_t
376isc_file_bopenuniqueprivate(char *templet, FILE **fp) {
377 int mode = S_IWUSR|S_IRUSR;
378 return (isc_file_openuniquemode(templet, mode, fp));
379}
380
381isc_result_t
382isc_file_bopenuniquemode(char *templet, int mode, FILE **fp) {
383 return (isc_file_openuniquemode(templet, mode, fp));
384}
385
386isc_result_t
387isc_file_remove(const char *filename) {
388 int r;
389
390 REQUIRE(filename != NULL);
391
392 r = unlink(filename);
393 if (r == 0)
394 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
395 else
396 return (isc__errno2result(errno));
397}
398
399isc_result_t
400isc_file_rename(const char *oldname, const char *newname) {
401 int r;
402
403 REQUIRE(oldname != NULL);
404 REQUIRE(newname != NULL);
405
406 r = rename(oldname, newname);
407 if (r == 0)
408 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
409 else
410 return (isc__errno2result(errno));
411}
412
413bool
414isc_file_exists(const char *pathname) {
415 struct stat stats;
416
417 REQUIRE(pathname != NULL);
418
419 return (file_stats(pathname, &stats) == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
420}
421
422isc_result_t
423isc_file_isplainfile(const char *filename) {
424 /*
425 * This function returns success if filename is a plain file.
426 */
427 struct stat filestat;
428 memset(&filestat,0,sizeof(struct stat));
429
430 if ((stat(filename, &filestat)) == -1)
431 return(isc__errno2result(errno));
432
433 if(! S_ISREG(filestat.st_mode))
434 return(ISC_R_INVALIDFILE);
435
436 return(ISC_R_SUCCESS);
437}
438
439isc_result_t
440isc_file_isplainfilefd(int fd) {
441 /*
442 * This function returns success if filename is a plain file.
443 */
444 struct stat filestat;
445 memset(&filestat,0,sizeof(struct stat));
446
447 if ((fstat(fd, &filestat)) == -1)
448 return(isc__errno2result(errno));
449
450 if(! S_ISREG(filestat.st_mode))
451 return(ISC_R_INVALIDFILE);
452
453 return(ISC_R_SUCCESS);
454}
455
456isc_result_t
457isc_file_isdirectory(const char *filename) {
458 /*
459 * This function returns success if filename exists and is a
460 * directory.
461 */
462 struct stat filestat;
463 memset(&filestat,0,sizeof(struct stat));
464
465 if ((stat(filename, &filestat)) == -1)
466 return(isc__errno2result(errno));
467
468 if(! S_ISDIR(filestat.st_mode))
469 return(ISC_R_INVALIDFILE);
470
471 return(ISC_R_SUCCESS);
472}
473
474
475bool
476isc_file_isabsolute(const char *filename) {
477 REQUIRE(filename != NULL);
478 return (filename[0] == '/');
479}
480
481bool
482isc_file_iscurrentdir(const char *filename) {
483 REQUIRE(filename != NULL);
484 return (filename[0] == '.' && filename[1] == '\0');
485}
486
487bool
488isc_file_ischdiridempotent(const char *filename) {
489 REQUIRE(filename != NULL);
490 if (isc_file_isabsolute(filename))
491 return (true);
492 if (isc_file_iscurrentdir(filename))
493 return (true);
494 return (false);
495}
496
497const char *
498isc_file_basename(const char *filename) {
499 const char *s;
500
501 REQUIRE(filename != NULL);
502
503 s = strrchr(filename, '/');
504 if (s == NULL)
505 return (filename);
506
507 return (s + 1);
508}
509
510isc_result_t
511isc_file_progname(const char *filename, char *buf, size_t buflen) {
512 const char *base;
513 size_t len;
514
515 REQUIRE(filename != NULL);
516 REQUIRE(buf != NULL);
517
518 base = isc_file_basename(filename);
519 len = strlen(base) + 1;
520
521 if (len > buflen)
522 return (ISC_R_NOSPACE);
523 memmove(buf, base, len);
524
525 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
526}
527
528/*
529 * Put the absolute name of the current directory into 'dirname', which is
530 * a buffer of at least 'length' characters. End the string with the
531 * appropriate path separator, such that the final product could be
532 * concatenated with a relative pathname to make a valid pathname string.
533 */
534static isc_result_t
535dir_current(char *dirname, size_t length) {
536 char *cwd;
537 isc_result_t result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
538
539 REQUIRE(dirname != NULL);
540 REQUIRE(length > 0U);
541
542 cwd = getcwd(dirname, length);
543
544 if (cwd == NULL) {
545 if (errno == ERANGE) {
546 result = ISC_R_NOSPACE;
547 } else {
548 result = isc__errno2result(errno);
549 }
550 } else {
551 if (strlen(dirname) + 1 == length) {
552 result = ISC_R_NOSPACE;
553 } else if (dirname[1] != '\0') {
554 strlcat(dirname, "/", length);
555 }
556 }
557
558 return (result);
559}
560
561isc_result_t
562isc_file_absolutepath(const char *filename, char *path, size_t pathlen) {
563 isc_result_t result;
564 result = dir_current(path, pathlen);
565 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
566 return (result);
567 if (strlen(path) + strlen(filename) + 1 > pathlen)
568 return (ISC_R_NOSPACE);
569 strlcat(path, filename, pathlen);
570 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
571}
572
573isc_result_t
574isc_file_truncate(const char *filename, isc_offset_t size) {
575 isc_result_t result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
576
577 if (truncate(filename, size) < 0)
578 result = isc__errno2result(errno);
579 return (result);
580}
581
582isc_result_t
583isc_file_safecreate(const char *filename, FILE **fp) {
584 isc_result_t result;
585 int flags;
586 struct stat sb;
587 FILE *f;
588 int fd;
589
590 REQUIRE(filename != NULL);
591 REQUIRE(fp != NULL && *fp == NULL);
592
593 result = file_stats(filename, &sb);
594 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
595 if ((sb.st_mode & S_IFREG) == 0)
596 return (ISC_R_INVALIDFILE);
597 flags = O_WRONLY | O_TRUNC;
598 } else if (result == ISC_R_FILENOTFOUND) {
599 flags = O_WRONLY | O_CREAT | O_EXCL;
600 } else
601 return (result);
602
603 fd = open(filename, flags, S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR);
604 if (fd == -1)
605 return (isc__errno2result(errno));
606
607 f = fdopen(fd, "w");
608 if (f == NULL) {
609 result = isc__errno2result(errno);
610 close(fd);
611 return (result);
612 }
613
614 *fp = f;
615 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
616}
617
618isc_result_t
619isc_file_splitpath(isc_mem_t *mctx, const char *path, char **dirname,
620 char const **bname)
621{
622 char *dir;
623 const char *file, *slash;
624
625 if (path == NULL)
626 return (ISC_R_INVALIDFILE);
627
628 slash = strrchr(path, '/');
629
630 if (slash == path) {
631 file = ++slash;
632 dir = isc_mem_strdup(mctx, "/");
633 } else if (slash != NULL) {
634 file = ++slash;
635 dir = isc_mem_allocate(mctx, slash - path);
636 if (dir != NULL)
637 strlcpy(dir, path, slash - path);
638 } else {
639 file = path;
640 dir = isc_mem_strdup(mctx, ".");
641 }
642
643 if (dir == NULL)
644 return (ISC_R_NOMEMORY);
645
646 if (*file == '\0') {
647 isc_mem_free(mctx, dir);
648 return (ISC_R_INVALIDFILE);
649 }
650
651 *dirname = dir;
652 *bname = file;
653
654 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
655}
656
657void *
658isc_file_mmap(void *addr, size_t len, int prot,
659 int flags, int fd, off_t offset)
660{
661#ifdef HAVE_MMAP
662 return (mmap(addr, len, prot, flags, fd, offset));
663#else
664 void *buf;
665 ssize_t ret;
666 off_t end;
667
668 UNUSED(addr);
669 UNUSED(prot);
670 UNUSED(flags);
671
672 end = lseek(fd, 0, SEEK_END);
673 lseek(fd, offset, SEEK_SET);
674 if (end - offset < (off_t) len)
675 len = end - offset;
676
677 buf = malloc(len);
678 if (buf == NULL)
679 return (NULL);
680
681 ret = read(fd, buf, len);
682 if (ret != (ssize_t) len) {
683 free(buf);
684 buf = NULL;
685 }
686
687 return (buf);
688#endif
689}
690
691int
692isc_file_munmap(void *addr, size_t len) {
693#ifdef HAVE_MMAP
694 return (munmap(addr, len));
695#else
696 UNUSED(len);
697
698 free(addr);
699 return (0);
700#endif
701}
702
703#define DISALLOW "\\/ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ"
704#ifndef PATH_MAX
705#define PATH_MAX 1024
706#endif
707
708static isc_result_t
709digest2hex(unsigned char *digest, unsigned int digestlen,
710 char *hash, size_t hashlen)
711{
712 unsigned int i;
713 int ret;
714 for (i = 0; i < digestlen; i++) {
715 size_t left = hashlen - i * 2;
716 ret = snprintf(hash + i * 2, left, "%02x", digest[i]);
717 if (ret < 0 || (size_t)ret >= left) {
718 return (ISC_R_NOSPACE);
719 }
720 }
721 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
722}
723
724isc_result_t
725isc_file_sanitize(const char *dir, const char *base, const char *ext,
726 char *path, size_t length)
727{
728 char buf[PATH_MAX];
729 unsigned char digest[ISC_MAX_MD_SIZE];
730 unsigned int digestlen;
731 char hash[ISC_MAX_MD_SIZE * 2 + 1];
732 size_t l = 0;
733 isc_result_t err;
734
735 REQUIRE(base != NULL);
736 REQUIRE(path != NULL);
737
738 l = strlen(base) + 1;
739
740 /*
741 * allow room for a full sha256 hash (64 chars
742 * plus null terminator)
743 */
744 if (l < 65U)
745 l = 65;
746
747 if (dir != NULL)
748 l += strlen(dir) + 1;
749 if (ext != NULL)
750 l += strlen(ext) + 1;
751
752 if (l > length || l > (unsigned)PATH_MAX)
753 return (ISC_R_NOSPACE);
754
755 /* Check whether the full-length SHA256 hash filename exists */
756 err = isc_md(ISC_MD_SHA256, (const unsigned char *)base,
757 strlen(base), digest, &digestlen);
758 if (err != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
759 return (err);
760 }
761
762 err = digest2hex(digest, digestlen, hash, sizeof(hash));
763 if (err != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
764 return (err);
765 }
766
767 snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "%s%s%s%s%s",
768 dir != NULL ? dir : "", dir != NULL ? "/" : "",
769 hash, ext != NULL ? "." : "", ext != NULL ? ext : "");
770 if (isc_file_exists(buf)) {
771 strlcpy(path, buf, length);
772 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
773 }
774
775 /* Check for a truncated SHA256 hash filename */
776 hash[16] = '\0';
777 snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "%s%s%s%s%s",
778 dir != NULL ? dir : "", dir != NULL ? "/" : "",
779 hash, ext != NULL ? "." : "", ext != NULL ? ext : "");
780 if (isc_file_exists(buf)) {
781 strlcpy(path, buf, length);
782 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
783 }
784
785 /*
786 * If neither hash filename already exists, then we'll use
787 * the original base name if it has no disallowed characters,
788 * or the truncated hash name if it does.
789 */
790 if (strpbrk(base, DISALLOW) != NULL) {
791 strlcpy(path, buf, length);
792 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
793 }
794
795 snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "%s%s%s%s%s",
796 dir != NULL ? dir : "", dir != NULL ? "/" : "",
797 base, ext != NULL ? "." : "", ext != NULL ? ext : "");
798 strlcpy(path, buf, length);
799 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
800}
801
802bool
803isc_file_isdirwritable(const char *path) {
804 return (access(path, W_OK|X_OK) == 0);
805}
